body: Tried the whl on https://flex-layout-demo.streamlit.app/ and the chat_input widget shrunk in size...
Oh yeah we didn't work on chat input yet, will fix soon! FYI @lawilby

Tried this out and my first impression: Awesome. That feature is exactly what I've been waiting for since I've started using streamlit to layout my apps üëç 
Apparently a few elements are still missing the new "width" parameter due to the error message `ReferenceError: width is not defined`, but as you stated this is still work in progress. Can't wait until this is released :)

issue.title: Add `st.badge` and Markdown badges

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
## Describe your changes

Adds two ways to add badges to Streamlit:
- A dedicated command `st.badge` that takes label, icon, and color. This is just a small wrapper around `st.markdown`. 
- A new Markdown directive, e.g. `:blue-badge[Badge text]`. 

Note that the `rainbow` color is not supported for badges because I couldn't get it to work after trying a bunch of different approaches, and it didn't seem worth investing more time into this given that it should be a very rare use case. See comment in the code. 

![Screenshot 2025-03-11 at 23 49 49@2x](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ff3f785d-73af-4a35-8d74-f358ca95c1ff)



## GitHub Issue Link (if applicable)

Closes #6443

## Testing Plan

- Added a quick Python unit test for `st.badge`. 
- Added a small E2E test for `st.badge` and Markdown badges. 

---

**Contribution License Agreement**

By submitting this pull request you agree that all contributions to this project are made under the Apache 2.0 license.

issue.title: Tailwind text colors set via ".classes" selectively don't work for buttons

repository.name: nicegui
repository.description: Create web-based user interfaces with Python. The nice way.

issue.body:
### Description

Trying to specify text color via ".classes" selector works well for labels and other elements but doesn't work for buttons when the color has a specified hue as can be seen on examples below:

Example code:
```py
from nicegui import ui

def main():
    ui.label('Label color works').classes("text-red-400")
    ui.button("Button color doesn't work").classes("text-red-400")
    ui.button("Unless it's pure color").classes("text-red")
    ui.run()

if __name__ in {"__main__", "__mp_main__"}:
    main()
```
Result:
![image](https://github.com/zauberzeug/nicegui/assets/1098586/37533911-dee2-4739-822c-6463cbb969ab)


## More examples using the styling function in the documentation, just to make sure it's not an issue with my environment

### For a label the "text-red-400" tailwind class works:

![image](https://github.com/zauberzeug/nicegui/assets/1098586/b0f01da1-3f8d-43dc-9dd4-724af6d83c6c)


### For a button, the same class doesn't work:

![image](https://github.com/zauberzeug/nicegui/assets/1098586/d6602b35-efdd-43c9-86ae-b8f0898506f8)


### Although this way it works:

![image](https://github.com/zauberzeug/nicegui/assets/1098586/cb5d63b8-3aea-4d62-aed1-1a333a894d53)

issue.title: Grid layout

labels.name: type:enhancement
labels.description: Requests for feature enhancements or new features

repository.name: streamlit
repository.description: Streamlit ‚Äî A faster way to build and share data apps.

issue.body:
### Checklist

- [x] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar feature requests.
- [x] I added a descriptive title and summary to this issue.

### Summary

Add a proper grid layout to Streamlit, e.g. as `st.grid`.

### Why?

Two main use cases:
- Showing similar elements (e.g. cards) in a grid/gallery view, were each element occupies one cell. 
- Creating complex dashboard layouts in a grid, where elements (e.g. charts or dataframes) can span multiple cells. 

### How?

TBD!

### Additional Context

Related:

- #10895 
- #5353

body: This would include using different elements together too right? Like I would like to add references to my chatbot answer. I would love it to have elements such as markdown + popover together in a horizontal direction !
What is the expected release date for this?

body: The flex-layout-demo doesn't seem to demonstrate any flex behaviour because the example layouts don't change at all as you make the page narrower. It only shows a few small elements and I've shrunk the width down to the minimum and they just stay in the same arrangement. Surely the point of flex layout is to rearrange elements as the horizontal space is reduced?
